title: 3 Ways to Make Adobe Acrobat Reader Your Default PDF Viewer

steps.title: Open the Windows File Explorer.
steps.content: Open the Windows File Explorer. An easy way to do this is to press ⊞ Win + E .

steps.title: Open the folder that contains a PDF file.
steps.content: Open the folder that contains a PDF file.

steps.title: Right-click the PDF.
steps.content: Right-click the PDF. A context menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Open with.
steps.content: Click Open with . Another menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Choose another app.
steps.content: Click Choose another app . Even if you have Acrobat Reader showing as one of the option, you should still select this option.

steps.title: Select Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.
steps.content: Select Adobe Acrobat Reader DC .

steps.title: Check the box next to “Always use this app to open .pdf files.”
steps.content: Check the box next to “Always use this app to open .pdf files.”

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Adobe Acrobat Reader is now your PDF default viewer.

steps.title: Click the search button.
steps.content: Click the search button. It’s either a magnifying glass or a circle to the right of the Start menu.

steps.title: Type default app into the search bar.
steps.content: Type default app into the search bar. A list of matches will appear.

steps.title: Click Default app settings.
steps.content: Click Default app settings .

steps.title: Scroll down and click Choose default app by file type.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Choose default app by file type .

steps.title: Scroll down to find the “.pdf” format.
steps.content: Scroll down to find the “.pdf” format. The current default app appears to the right.

steps.title: Click the current default app.
steps.content: Click the current default app. A list of apps will appear.

steps.title: Click Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.
steps.content: Click Adobe Acrobat Reader DC . Adobe Acrobat Reader is now the default PDF viewer.

steps.title: Open Finder on your Mac .
steps.content: Open Finder on your Mac . You’ll find this icon in the Dock, which is usually at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Browse to a folder that contains a PDF.
steps.content: Browse to a folder that contains a PDF.

steps.title: Press Ctrl as you click the file.
steps.content: Press Ctrl as you click the file. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Get info.
steps.content: Click Get info .

steps.title: Select Adobe Reader from the “Open With” drop-down.
steps.content: Select Adobe Reader from the “Open With” drop-down.

steps.title: Click Change all.
steps.content: Click Change all . A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . Adobe Reader is now your default PDF viewer.
